message.content:
cs.CR, cs.HC, cs.CY, cs.SE, cs.MM

The paper discusses the security, privacy, and safety risks associated with virtual reality learning environments, which falls under the category of computer security (cs.CR). Additionally, the paper focuses on the user experience and usability of the VRLE, which aligns with the human-computer interaction (cs.HC) sub-category. The use of attack trees to assess risks is a common technique in cybersecurity (cs.CY) and software engineering (cs.SE). Finally, the paper uses a VR testbed to demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed framework, which falls under the multimedia (cs.MM) sub-category.
